name: The Puteri Pacific Hotel Johor Bahru

reviews.text: Stayed a couple of nights, hotel was near the event we attended thus it was for convenience rather than a choice. It's an old hotel that needs severe renovation to attract customers, coffee house given a make over but that's not enough to really put it up as 4 star hotel. Wasn't sure if there are other restaurants they operate, there used to be a Chinese and middle eastern one which I believe has closed down. But having said that most hotels in JB are probably of the same quality and you will not find quality hotels as in Kuala Lumpur.
reviews.title: Hotel that needs refurbishment

reviews.text: Stayed in the same hotel when it was called Pan Pacific around 10 years back. I was shocked to see the room was in the same condition, with poorly maintained bathtub and old style TV. The hotel charges a lot for its rooms but doesn't do a good upkeep and updating their rooms. Breakfast wasn't that good, not many choices. Wireless internet in the room didn't work properly, ended up using 3G service on the phone. Wouldn't recommend staying in this hotel unless you really need to be close to the causeway.
reviews.title: Poor Interior

reviews.text: First of all if this is not our annual family activities ( Watching Chinese Chingay ) after Chinese New Year we will not choose this Hotel for our overnight stay.
reviews.title: Worst hotel I had ever stayed! Avoid this terrible Hotel!!

reviews.text: The Car Park services is bad also, not allowing me to park my car which i am staying at this hotel with Children's. I have to unloading my luggage in a hurry and my wife have to bring my kids down together while checking in the hotel. The Staff performance is slow, have to wait 45 min !! The Hotel car park is full, i have to park at the next building. I try to ask it is possible to park my car in front of the lobby there as i saw some empty car park that is for valet parking and they are not being helpful at all, have to pay Rm 15 for it (per entry) When i had taken my room i found the air cont is not working at all as firstly i was thinking that maybe it is because of we just checked into the hotel so have to wait for a longer periods of time to cool of the room. My poor children's are very tired and slept it without air cont for an hours, as i start to wondering why such a expensive hotel services is so bad, no air cont and no car park option for those hotel guess that is traveling with Children's. I try to call my others families members that to ask do they facing the same problem as me? As all of the Hotel rooms are hot ! We demand to ask for changing rooms all of together but they tend to ignore our complain ! We are so angry as watching our kids are sweating! the Manger does not replying our request fast, as i think they are pretty busy. Worst still as during the changing of the rooms, the Manager did given me a Big shocked as while entering the hotel card as after opening the door of the hotel room the room is occupied and the door is hooked. The person whom is staying at the room and i the person whom is holding the hotel card , both of us equally shocked. I quickly apologies to them. The Manager and the staff attitude is bad they even do not say Sorry to us while when we are checking out during the next day. The room that i paid is expensive room and while when we requesting for changing the room due of the air cont not working they given me a lower type of the room. I think their service is bad and not worth to stay at all.
reviews.title: Your Below Average Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed there for a night with a friend as we had to attend a wedding.
reviews.title: Not worth the price

reviews.text: I had originally booked to stay at the Citrus, only to found out it's a budget hotel (advertised as mid range). I am glad I switched to the Puteri Pacific after the first night. I had a very early check in and was upgraded to a family room. The staff at the Puteri Pacific are incredibly warm and eager to please (Malaysian hospitality). I had access to a gym and pool, which were very important for me (none at the Citrus). The property itself is a bit dated, but rooms are large. Be sure to ask for a non-smoking room, as people still smoke like chimneys in this part of the world. I had breakfast every morning at the Puteri Cafe, and the spread is very good. They put out both local and Western selections (although no fresh juice or skim milk). The location can't be beat - 5 mins walk to City Square (large mall) and the train station (JB Central). Overall I would recommend this hotel for an additional USD $12-15 over the Citrus.
reviews.title: Warm, wonderful staff

reviews.text: Choosing a hotel during a business trip is not as easy as it looks like. It has to be within the company's budget, must be business friendly ie: free wifi, good bed to sleep in,good location and a good desk for working.
reviews.title: Value for money

reviews.text: This hotel has it all. The service is excellent compared to Thistle JB. i'm amazed from the time i got out from my car up till my room. Everything was in order. The staff is so friendly and helpful. One of the front desk lady help me out with direction to my meeting location and put down the hotel number and ask me to call the hotel if i got lost. This definitely do not happen in Malaysia especially.
reviews.title: Don't Bother with Executive Lounge - Go Other Level or Somewhere Else

reviews.text: The location of the hotel is just nice. In the middle of the city and there are so many ways/road to go to everywhere in JB.
reviews.title: Good breakfast selection and big size room

reviews.text: The only thing the hotel have to highly consider is to refurbish all guest rooms. The air conditioning did not function well. The hair dryer looks old and feels old. the cold shower doesn't work. There is only hot water. Bed is comfortable enough but definitely needs changing. As a business traveller, the desk is not a place for me to do my work and the poor lighting makes it harder to work in the room.
reviews.title: Tired room

reviews.text: The Puteri Pacific reminds me of an old lady . . .
reviews.title: The Good, the Bad and the Ugly

reviews.text: The good is that she is comfortable, friendly, can cook well and is too old to try pretend to be 'modern' and new.
reviews.title: Sad turnaround

reviews.text: The bad is that she has that worn look and smells slightly 'old' and you can see that some 'refurbishments' are being done
reviews.title: Nice place to stay but...

reviews.text: The ugly is the 20-year old TV and TV remote control with more germs on it than Typhoid Mary and that the thin-ness of the sheets can be double up by placing tissues on it.
reviews.title: A short getaway

reviews.text: On a more serious note - the staff are very polite and helpful. All the staff!
reviews.title: Just an average hotel

reviews.text: Overall it is a not bad stay if u don't have high expectation... Only turn off is 3pm check in, carpet abit dirty, sofa wear off. Bathroom look clean but the bathtub have some stain.. Buffet breakfast is average, swimming pool ok, abit small
reviews.title: Not bad stay

reviews.text: Warm friendly staff, breakfast not bad,location close to shopping centres, and rent a car is next door.USS package from the hotel was excellent as we were the only passengers on board the shuttle bus to and from USS.
reviews.title: Central to shops, USS

reviews.text: If you stay on the executive floor (15th), access to meals and drinks on the 16th floor is an "executive" perk as well as complimentary laundry service and a number of other benefits. My group of 10 all stayed on the 15th floor and visited the 16th floor daily. Jay's service on the 16th floor was over the top and made the stay more than worthwhile. His attention to detail and interesting conversation about the city were so welcome and the food and drink were great as well. Now about the hotel room- I had a renovated 2 room suite and I think low bid won the contract. No hot water, despite repeated requests, in the tub/shower during my entire 5 night stay. i had the opportunity to change hotels but refused because of Jay's great service on the 16th floor. In fact, everyone was awesome on the 16th floor which enabled our group to tolerate the disadvantages of their personal hotel rooms. You were made to feel quite special. The fitness center was large but the equipment seemed dated. It did not open until 7 am so no early morning workouts were even possible! One additional advantage- The hotel is close to a lot nearby shopping.
reviews.title: Executive 15th Floor a Must- Jay's service on 16th floor was the highlight

reviews.text: Friendly staff, however the hotel needs major makeover. The air cond wasn't functioning well when we came. Leaky faucet, no hot water, no towel hanger in the toilet and other than the lift being warm, it took a minute for the lift to actually close. The lift from the car park to the hotel was horrendous, it was full with sand and stones, just like a construction site. Overall the only good thing about this hotel is the warm and friendly staff. The hotel itself is terrible. Would not recommend it to anyone. Such a disappointment, with the rate I'm paying.
reviews.title: Worst hotel ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: stayed a nite on sat 16 mar, rms start frm deluxe omwards. Arrived at 1230pm, saw check in time only at 3pm. But happi e helpful n friendly recep said no problm, rm avail for early checkin! Smiles. Tis hotel was definately much better 10yrs back but ok not too bad cond. Though sbit on e oldish furnitures. They shd replace them! Anyway they r having sm renov gng on but no loud noices. Aircon not too cold but ok for us. Location is damn gd, opp e ciq n city square mall, cab to shpg ctrs inner city only rm8. At least taxis know tis big hotel. Overall, comfortable n clean.
reviews.title: Sure was not as bad as thought!

description: The Puteri Pacific Johor Bahru is the largest 5 stars hotel in southern Malaysia, boasting 500 deluxe rooms, suites & apartments. Located in the centre of Johor Bahru with easy access to Singapore via the causeway. The Puteri Pacific Johor Bahru is a business and convention-focused hotel offering 500 appealing guestrooms, apartments and suites, all equipped with high-speed broadband internet access.For dining purposes, a combined offering of food and beverage outlets feature an extensive selection of local and international cuisine. These include; Selasih Restaurant, which offers traditional, authentic Johorean and Malaysian cuisine at Restoran Selasih; western-dining at Paolo; and Cantonese and Szechuan cuisine at Kai Xuan. For casual dining, Newsroom Café offers local and international food fare.For recreational activities, Pacific Fitness Centre is equipped with a modern gym, sauna, steam room and Jacuzzi pools, tennis and squash courts, and an outdoor swimming pool. A choice of 29 function rooms and Convention/Exhibition spaces with necessary facilities are readily available to cater to your needs.
